timeline.bodyText: This function should be merged with the one above.  We can change the name to explain and remove the other function.  This will require a few other changes as well.
timeline.author: aklish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -200,4 +201,14 @@ public Table getTable(String classAlias) {
      * @return SQL string corresponding to the given query
      */
     public abstract String explain(Query query);
+
+    /**
+     * Builds the specified {@link Query} against a specific persistent storage, which understand the provided
+     * {@link Query}.
+     *
+     * @param query The query customized for a particular persistent storage or storage client
+     * @return query string
+     */
+    public abstract List<String> showQueries(Query query);

timeline.bodyText: All of these classes need the copyright statement added and also javadoc at the class level so the linter doesn't complain.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: No asterisk imports.  I wonder if the checkstyle is not enabled on this code?  It ought to be.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I don't think codacy complained about this one. Do new files need to be added to a config to get checked?
replies.author: HarveyC3

replies.bodyText: Not codacy - but checkstyle.  All the elide repos have a checkstyle plugin that gets run during the compile phase.  The build should fail if there is a problem.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Instead of having a static method and map that binds these values to their respective queries - the enumeration itself can have arguments for each value.  I would make a QueryProvider (function that takes no arguments and returns a query) as the argument to each enumeration value.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.author: HarveyC3
aklish

timeline.bodyText: What about pagination offset and limit?
timeline.author: aklish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -62,7 +76,31 @@
 
     protected QueryEngine.Transaction transaction;
 
-    public static void init() {
+    // Standard set of test queries used in dialect tests
+    protected enum TestQueryName {
+        WHERE_METRICS_ONLY,
+        WHERE_DIMS_ONLY,
+        WHERE_METRICS_AND_DIMS,
+        WHERE_METRICS_OR_DIMS,
+        WHERE_METRICS_AGGREGATION,
+        HAVING_METRICS_ONLY,
+        HAVING_DIMS_ONLY,
+        HAVING_METRICS_AND_DIMS,
+        HAVING_METRICS_OR_DIMS,
+        PAGINATION_TOTAL,

replies.bodyText: how should the queries differ for those?
replies.author: HarveyC3

replies.bodyText:
There are three things you can ask for pagination:

totals - total number of rows
offset - starting row
limit - number of rows returned in the response.

Each dialect will have a different way of paginating offset and limit.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Not sure what this means.  the group by is in the select isn't it?

replies.bodyText: The intent is to have a field in the GROUP BY that's not part of the SELECT. I'll double check what's going wrong with this one.
replies.author: HarveyC3

replies.bodyText: I think it is part of the select though.
replies.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: I changed this from GROUP BY to ORDER BY, which doesn't push the field into the SELECT.
replies.author: HarveyC3

timeline.bodyText: I think we ought to add a few tests for time dimensions - time dimensions in WHERE, time dimensions in HAVING, and time dimensions in GROUP BY

timeline.bodyText:
It would be good to break out most of these feature tests by table and by subquery.  By features, I mean:
WHERE
HAVING
TIME Dimensions
PAGINATION
SORTING

replies.bodyText: Is your ask to create two versions of the existing tests - 1 for table and 1 for subquery? Or just to update the names to clearly show whether they're table or subquery tests?
replies.author: HarveyC3

replies.bodyText: The former - I think we should test most features for both tables and subqueries.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.message: Add copyright statements and class javadoc entries

Rework TestQuery enum.
Change GROUP_BY_NOT_IN_SELECT to ORDER_BY_NOT_IN_SELECT.

timeline.bodyText: I would make a new static method for parsing filter expressions that throws an Illegal State or Argument exception.  Codacy doesn't like runtime exceptions.
timeline.author: aklish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -62,7 +83,225 @@
 
     protected QueryEngine.Transaction transaction;
 
-    public static void init() {
+    // Standard set of test queries used in dialect tests
+    protected enum TestQuery {
+        WHERE_METRICS_ONLY (() -> {

+        WHERE_DIMS_ONLY (() -> {

+                    .build();
+        }),
+        WHERE_METRICS_OR_DIMS (() -> {

+                        .sorting(new SortingImpl(sortMap, PlayerStats.class, dictionary))
+                        .whereFilter(predicate)
+                        // force a join to look up countryIsoCode
+                        .havingFilter(filterParser.parseFilterExpression("countryIsoCode==USA",

timeline.bodyText: We should have comments for the interface methods
timeline.author: aklish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+/*

+ * See LICENSE file in project root for terms.
+ */
+package com.yahoo.elide.datastores.aggregation.queryengines.sql.dialects;
+
+/**
+ * Interface for SQL Dialects used to customize SQL queries for specific persistent storage.
+ */
+public interface SQLDialect {
+
+    String getDialectType();

timeline.message: Add method comments to SQLDialect. Don't throw RuntimeException in SQLUnitTest.
